title: Taking the Transpose
text: A matrix transpose is when a column vector is turned into a row vector, or vice versa.

title: Meaning of Row and Column
text: Row and column vectors are two different kinds of vectors, but can be changed into one or the other through the transpose, denoted by a superscript T.

title: Determining Vector
text: What kind of vector is the vector $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{bmatrix}$$?

subHints.title: Determining Vector
subHints.text: What kind of vector would the transpose of $$\begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \\ 4 \end{bmatrix}$$ be?

title: Transposed Vector
text: A transposed vector turns each of the columns in to a different row. If there is only one column, the corresponding transpose only has one row.
